page.title: 06The Hellifield Auction Mart
page.content: This is one of the oldest business concerns in Hellifield. There is one main Sale Day, held on Thursday each week. Sheep, cows and bulls are transported here in wagons by road, to be sold in the auction ring to butchers or their agents, after first being passed by a government inspector. The Auction Staff includes the auctioneer and his assistant, and clerks who deal with bills etc. Outside workers drive the animals first onto the weighing machines, and after the sale into pens to await transportation to their new owners. On busy days 2,000 to 3,000 sheep are brought to the auction, and 300 to 400 cattle from as far away as Kendal and Halifax. An average price for a sheep is Â£35, for cattle Â£450 each.
